newsitem.title: USA: South Carolina evacuates coastline as Fran nears.
newsitem.headline: South Carolina evacuates coastline as Fran nears.

text.p: South Carolina Gov. David Beasley called for a mandatory evacuation of vulnerable coastal areas Wednesday as Hurricane Fran moved across the Atlantic toward the state.
Beginning at 1400 EDT/1800 GMT, Beasley ordered the evacuation of barrier islands and other low-lying areas near water, beachfront properties and mobile homes.
Officials in Charleston said the evacuation was ordered Wednesday afternoon to avoid forcing residents to travel at night.

As of 1400, Fran's center was about 445 miles (716 km) southeast of Charleston and moving northwest at 12 mph (19 kmh). Forecasters said the South Carolina coast, already experiencing higher swells, would begin to get gale force winds later Wednesday.
